snippet: Shabaka Shakur, 48, who was convicted in the January 1988 killings of two men, will get the chance to dispute a confession he says was fabricated by the former detective Louis Scarcella.
abstract: Shabaka Shakur, Brooklyn man serving two consecutive 20-years-to-life sentences for two murders he says he did not commit, has been granted hearing by Justice Desmond Green of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn to review new evidence; review will also determine whether New York Detective Louis Scarcella of Brooklyn, whose investigative work has been called into question, manufactured confession.
lead_paragraph: Shabaka Shakur, 48, who was convicted in the January 1988 killings of two men, will get the chance to dispute a confession he says was fabricated by the former detective Louis Scarcella.

headline.main: Judge to Hear Accusations Against Police by an Inmate
